roleset.name: incur, unwillingly take on
roleset.note: INCUR-V NOTES: Comparison with 'suffer'. No verbnet entry, no FN. Checked by Julia, 10/2010. (from incur.01-v)

example.name: active
example.text: Or he-1 might have *trace*-1 to incur a huge expense of either buying Mr. Icahn's stock, possibly at a premium, or paying stockholders a special dividend partly because of Mr. Icahn's pressure.
example.arg: a huge expense of either buying Mr. Icahn's stock, possibly at a premium, or paying stockholders a special dividend partly because of Mr. Icahn's pressure

example.name: with cause of penalty
example.text: The law could redound to the advantage of brokers and banks, who-1 *trace*-1 incur high administrative costs to deliver securities to investors.

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: Takeover stock speculators have incurred paper losses of over $700 million from the failed UAL offer, their worst loss ever on a single deal.
example.arg: their worst loss ever on a single deal

example.name: passivized
example.text: The company also said expenses-1 incurred *trace*-1 by the previous board and management in the recent contest for control were recognized primarily in the first quarter ended Sept. 30.
example.arg: by the previous board and management
in the recent contest for control
